New Records: Austin Reaves scored 35 points, the highest single-game output for the Lakers in the match.
Key Match Events: The Lakers stormed back and cut the lead to three, 30-33, after a floater by LeBron James.
The Cavaliers maintained separation as they started the fourth with a 9-2 run to push the lead to 16, 96-80, after a triple by Georges Niang.
Back-to-back-to-back shots by Jarrett Allen kept Los Angeles at bay, 118-107, with 1:28 remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers have won their eight straight game and rose to 29-4, while the Lakers dropped to 18-14 for the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland showcased why it is the top team in the NBA, leading by as much as 16 points against the home team.
Evan Mobley added 20 points and six rebounds for Cleveland, while Max Strus and Darius Garland had 15 and 14, respectively.
Others: Darius Garland posted a pair of free throws by Darius Garland to go up by double digits, 29-14, in the first quarter.
The two teams were kept in a close match through the next two quarters before Cleveland turned a 77-75 advantage with 3:44 left in the third to an 87-78 lead heading into the final frame.
